Containers.Name: S3Backup
Containers.Description: Automatically backup one or more folders to Amazon S3[br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/data[/b] This is where you need to mount your volumes which you want backed up.[br][br] Volumes can be mounted read-only, and you can mount multiple volumes below, for example:[br] - Container volume: /data/documents, Host path: /mnt/user/documents[br] - Container volume: /data/photos, Host path: /mnt/user/media/photos[br][br] You [span style='color: #E80000;']must[/span] set the correct envionment variables for the container. Click on "Advanced view" in the top right and fill in the filelds[br] - ACCESS_KEY - your AWS access key[br] - SECRET_KEY - your AWS secret key[br] - S3PATH - your S3 bucket and path, eg. s3://mybucket/[br][br]
Containers.Overview: A simple way to backup important files to Amazon S3 and Glacier.
